filmography.title: Little Caesar
filmography.role_description: A small-time hoodlum who ruthlessly rises through the ranks to become a powerful Chicago mob boss in the role that made Robinson a star.
filmography.plot: A small-time criminal moves to Chicago and seeks fortune and power by joining a gang, eventually becoming its leader before his inevitable fall.

filmography.title: Smart Money
filmography.role_description: A successful small-town barber and gambler who moves to the big city and builds a gambling empire.
filmography.plot: A barber with a talent for gambling moves to the city to take on the big shots, but his weakness for women threatens his success.
filmography.awards: Only film pairing with James Cagney

filmography.title: Five Star Final
filmography.role_description: A conflicted newspaper editor who is pressured by his publisher to revive a 20-year-old murder scandal to boost circulation.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor exploits a decades-old murder case for sales, leading to tragic consequences for the woman involved and her family.

filmography.title: The Whole Town's Talking
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing both a meek, law-abiding clerk and the notorious gangster who happens to be his exact double.
filmography.plot: A timid clerk is mistaken for a vicious public enemy, leading to a series of mix-ups when the police give him a special pass to avoid arrest.

filmography.title: Bullets or Ballots
filmography.role_description: A tough police detective who goes undercover to infiltrate a powerful crime syndicate run by a mysterious boss.
filmography.plot: A detective pretends to be fired from the force to infiltrate a gang and take down the mob leaders from the inside.

filmography.title: Kid Galahad
filmography.role_description: A tough fight promoter who discovers a talented bellhop and grooms him for the championship, sparking a rivalry with a mobster.
filmography.plot: A boxing promoter builds up a naive young fighter but conflicts arise when the boxer falls for the promoter's sister.

filmography.title: A Slight Case of Murder
filmography.role_description: A former bootlegger trying to go legitimate as a brewer after the repeal of Prohibition, facing hilarious complications.
filmography.plot: A gangster tries to become a respectable businessman after Prohibition ends, but his past associates and bad beer make it difficult.

filmography.title: Confessions of a Nazi Spy
filmography.role_description: A dedicated FBI agent who uncovers a Nazi spy ring operating within the United States before World War II.
filmography.plot: An FBI agent investigates a spy ring in the U.S. that is stealing military secrets and spreading Nazi propaganda.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: Dr. Ehrlich's Magic Bullet
filmography.role_description: The brilliant German scientist who fights the medical establishment to find a cure for syphilis.
filmography.plot: A biographical drama about the scientist who discovered Salvarsan, the first effective treatment for syphilis, amidst professional and social opposition.

filmography.title: Brother Orchid
filmography.role_description: A mob boss who, after a failed attempt to reclaim his gang, hides out in a monastery and discovers a new life.
filmography.plot: A gangster retires to seek "class" in Europe but returns to find his gang taken over, eventually finding refuge with a group of monks.

filmography.title: The Sea Wolf
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical and sadistic ship captain who torments a writer and two fugitives he rescues from a shipwreck.
filmography.plot: Survivors of a ferry collision are rescued by a seal-hunting schooner run by a brutal captain who holds them captive.

filmography.title: Tales of Manhattan
filmography.role_description: A down-on-his-luck lawyer living in a flophouse who attends a high-class reunion wearing a cursed tailcoat.
filmography.plot: An anthology film following a black tailcoat as it passes between different owners, affecting each of their lives.

filmography.title: Larceny, Inc.
filmography.role_description: A criminal who buys a luggage shop to tunnel into the bank next door, only to find legitimate business success distracting him.
filmography.plot: Three ex-convicts buy a luggage store to rob the bank next door but find themselves becoming respected pillars of the community.

filmography.title: Double Indemnity
filmography.role_description: A brilliant and tenacious insurance claims adjuster who slowly unravels a murder plot devised by his own colleague.
filmography.plot: An insurance representative lets himself be talked by a seductive housewife into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses the suspicion of his claims adjuster.

filmography.title: The Woman in the Window
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered psychology professor who becomes entangled in a nightmare of murder and blackmail after meeting a mysterious woman.
filmography.plot: A conservative professor engages in an innocent flirtation with a femme fatale that leads to accidental death and a cover-up.

filmography.title: Scarlet Street
filmography.role_description: A meek cashier and amateur painter who is seduced and exploited by a femme fatale and her boyfriend, leading to tragedy.
filmography.plot: A lonely middle-aged man is exploited by a woman and her pimp boyfriend, leading to a crime of passion.

filmography.title: The Stranger
filmography.role_description: A relentless war crimes investigator who tracks a high-ranking Nazi fugitive to a small Connecticut town.
filmography.plot: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to a small town to find an infamous Nazi war criminal posing as a professor.

filmography.title: The Red House
filmography.role_description: A handicapped farmer with a dark secret about a mysterious red house in the woods that he tries to keep his adopted daughter from discovering.
filmography.plot: An aging brother and sister try to hide a terrible secret from their adopted daughter about an abandoned house in the woods.

filmography.title: Key Largo
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, exiled mobster who holds a hotel full of people hostage during a hurricane in Florida.
filmography.plot: A man visits his war buddy's family hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Claire Trevor)

filmography.title: All My Sons
filmography.role_description: A successful businessman who conceals a dark secret about defective airplane parts he sold during the war.
filmography.plot: A man who sold defective parts to the Air Force during WWII lives with the guilt as his son prepares to marry the daughter of his imprisoned partner.

filmography.title: Night Has a Thousand Eyes
filmography.role_description: A phony mentalist who discovers he actually has the power to foresee death, a gift that becomes a curse.
filmography.plot: A stage mentalist discovers he has real clairvoyant powers and predicts a woman's death, then tries to prevent it.

filmography.title: House of Strangers
filmography.role_description: A domineering Italian-American banker whose tyrannical rule over his four sons leads to family conflict and betrayal.
filmography.plot: A patriarch's control over his banking empire and his sons leads to resentment and a plot for revenge within the family.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: A treacherous Hebrew overseer who spies for the Egyptians and later incites the Israelites against Moses.
filmography.plot: Moses discovers his Hebrew heritage and leads his people out of Egypt, facing the wrath of Pharaoh and dissent among his followers.

filmography.title: Two Weeks in Another Town
filmography.role_description: A washed-up film director in Rome who tries to revive his career while manipulating his former star.
filmography.plot: A former movie star trying to make a comeback visits Rome to work with a director who once mentored him.

filmography.title: The Prize
filmography.role_description: A physics Nobel laureate who gets caught up in a Cold War kidnapping plot involving his twin brother.
filmography.plot: An American writer arriving in Stockholm to accept the Nobel Prize stumbles upon a communist plot to kidnap a scientist.

filmography.title: Cheyenne Autumn
filmography.role_description: The U.S. Secretary of the Interior who tries to intervene and help the Cheyenne people during their tragic exodus.
filmography.plot: The Cheyenne Indians embark on a perilous trek back to their ancestral lands, pursued by the US Cavalry.

filmography.title: Robin and the 7 Hoods
filmography.role_description: A Chicago mob boss who is murdered at his birthday party in an uncredited cameo that sets the plot in motion.
filmography.plot: A Chicago gangster tries to maintain his territory against a rival while becoming a philanthropic hero to the public.

filmography.title: The Cincinnati Kid
filmography.role_description: An aging, masterful poker player who accepts a high-stakes challenge from an up-and-coming young gambler.
filmography.plot: An up-and-coming poker player tries to prove himself in a high-stakes match against a long-time master of the game.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Mackenna's Gold
filmography.role_description: A blind elderly man who claims to have seen a legendary canyon of gold and warns others of the Apache spirits guarding it.
filmography.plot: A marshal is kidnapped by an outlaw who forces him to lead a group to a legendary valley of gold.

filmography.title: Soylent Green
filmography.role_description: An elderly researcher and roommate to the protagonist who uncovers a horrific secret about the food supply; Robinson's final film role.
filmography.plot: In a dystopian future, a detective investigates a murder that leads him to a dark secret about the food manufacturing company Soylent Corporation.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Win – Best Science Fiction Film
